title: Jillian W. Reynolds
text:
I am currently a second-year research master student in the Modern History and International Relations program at University of Groningen, Netherlands.

I grew up in the San Francisco Bay Area. While attending Sequoia High School, I balanced the IB Diploma Programme with competitive soccer and school sports.
After graduating from Sequoia, I attended UC San Diego in La Jolla, California. At UCSD, I majored in Political Science/International Relations and earned minors in History and Global Health.
After graduating with my BA in 2023, I spent a year working as a paraeducator for a local public school district while completing the four-course R for Data Analytics certificate program through UC San Diego Division of Extended Studies.

title: About
text:
I grew up in the San Francisco Bay Area. While attending Sequoia High School, I balanced the IB Diploma Programme with competitive soccer and school sports.
After graduating from Sequoia, I attended UC San Diego in La Jolla, California. At UCSD, I majored in Political Science/International Relations and earned minors in History and Global Health.
After graduating with my BA in 2023, I spent a year working as a paraeducator for a local public school district while completing the four-course R for Data Analytics certificate program through UC San Diego Division of Extended Studies.
I am currently attending the University of Groningen.

title: Jillian W. Reynolds
text: I am currently a second-year research master student in the Modern History and International Relations program at University of Groningen, Netherlands.

title: Research
text:
My current research interests are:

Affective polarization, also ideological and geographic polarization
Public opinion
Political behavior
California politics

For a better idea of what I have been working on, see Papers

title: Experiences
text:
High School Student Poll Worker, San Mateo County Assessor-County Clerk- Recorder & Elections, San Mateo County, CA — Nov. 2018
I participated in a program for eligible high school students to work Election Day at a poll. I greeted voters, facilitated paperwork, and passed out stickers.
